Author: bailey8889
Content: @BreakingTaps Not sure what you're asking. `COMP`, `N+`, `P+` are separate mask layers. Are you suggesting just using `N+` and `P+` and calculating the `COMP` mask layer from those?

Author: polyfractal
Content:
sorry, poorly worded. My understanding is that you need `COMP` + [`N+` or `P`] to define an active region. `COMP` by itself doesn't do anything, and I don't understand what `N+` / `P+` would equal if it wasn't also sitting on top of `COMP`.

Basically my question is why have `COMP` as a layer at all üôÇ

Author: polyfractal
Content: oh I see, they are _actual_ physical mask layers. Implementation detail leaking to the user
